text: Neil Evitts (born 25 September 1964 in Birmingham, England) is a former speedway rider who finished eighth in the World Championship in 1986 .Bamford, R. & Shailes, G. (2002). A History of the World Speedway Championship. Stroud: Tempus Publishing. In 1986 he also won the British Speedway Championship, then finished runner-up in 1987. That year he also became the captain of England. Neil finished his career in 1994 riding for the Newcastle Diamonds when he failed miserably trying to replace Paul Thorp ==World final appearances== ===Individual World Championship=== * 1986 - Chorzów, Silesian Stadium - 8th - 8pts ===World Team Cup=== * 1986 - Göteborg, Ullevi and Vojens, Speedway Center (with Simon Wigg / Kelvin Tatum / Jeremy Doncaster / Chris Morton) - 3rd - 81pts (8) ==References== Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:British speedway riders Category:English motorcycle racers Category:British Speedway Championship winners Category:Birmingham Brummies riders Category:Halifax Dukes riders Category:Bradford Dukes riders Category:Stoke Potters riders Category:Wolverhampton Wolves riders
